## Natural history notes

The Fascicled Beaksedge (Rhynchospora fascicularis) is a perennial sedge native to the southeastern United States. The spikelets are range between 3.5 to 5 mm in size and are reddish brown in color. It can be found growing within sandy and peaty soils. It commonly inhabits pine savana habitat, but also coastal plains.
